IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The mission of Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD) is to stop drunk driving, support the victims of this violent crime and prevent underage drinking.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Founded by a mother who lost her daughter in a crash, Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD) is the nation's largest nonprofit working to protect families from drunk driving and underage drinking. MADD also supports drunk driving victims and survivors - serving one person every 10 minutes - at no charge. Drunk Driving MADD's Campaign to Eliminate Drunk Driving has the goal of protecting families from drunk driving and ultimately ending the threat of drunk driving on American roads through the following: -Support the heroes who keep our roads safe. High-visibility law enforcement catches drunk drivers and discourages others from driving drunk. -Require convicted drunk drivers to blow before they go. Ignition interlock devices, or in-car breathalyzers, require all convicted drunk drivers to prove they are sober before the car will start. -Turn cars into the cure. Tomorrow's cars will protect each of us, automatically determining whether or not the driver is at or above the legal limit of .
IRS990.Description: Community programs--programs, prevention activities and other awareness campaigns that are administered by the National Office and local chapters to achieve the mission of MADD. These include programs to promote greater awareness about the problem of impaired drivers and underage drinking, programs to mobilize communities in eliminating these problems, support and advocacy services to drunk driving victims and their families, and other related programs.

Activity2.Description: Field Services-activities incurred by the National Office to enable state and chapter offices to meet the mission of MADD, such as educational programming, program development and education of field staff and volunteers.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIBE THE INTENDED USES OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The income of the endowment fund is to be used in Hamilton County, OH for children and public education and awarenes, and to aid victims.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Reconciliation of Revenue per Audit to 990
Reconciliation of Expenses per Audit to 990

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Cathey Wise--separation payment paid in June, 2010 $84,011 Heidi Castle--separation payment paid in July, 2009 $13,547

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD) has a gift acceptance policy for the type of contributions that have historically been received. A revised policy to cover all non-standard contributions, in the event one is received, is now in process.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: hire or use third parties or related organizations
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD) has contracts with 3rd parties who promote vehicle donations, collect and sell the vehicles, and execute all paperwork required by various agencies.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: describe the process organization used to review the Form 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board and senior management are sent a copy of the Form 990 to review prior to filing. A commentary highlighting key elements of the return is also provided. Any review comments are incorporated into the final version of the Form 990, if necessary.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: description of THE compliance with the conflict of interest policy
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD)'s Board of Directors, along with Key Employees, must complete a Conflict of Interest Questionnaire on an annual basis and are required to report any new conflict, if any, as it arises.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: description of the process for determining compensation
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD) has an independent Compensation Committee of the Board that evaluates and determines the compensation of its CEO and other Key Employees. The Committee uses compensation data from various resources, such as studies that specifically evaluate salaries of nonprofit employees, in order to determine the reasonableness of any compensation it must contemplate and approve. The minutes of the meetings of the Compensation Committee are recorded contemporaneously with deliberation and decision.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: AVAIL OF GOV DOCS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, & FIN STMETS TO GEN PUBLIC
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
